VISITONS MIMI - Series I
Grade 2
- 2 -
Station KSLH (91.5 M.C.)
1517 South Theresa Avenue
TO THE TEACHER WHO DOES NOT KNOW FRENCH:
The committee has sought to make this series easy, even though the
handbook may look disturbingly peculiar to you. Every phrase re¬
appears many times.
As lessons proceed, the first tune is modified and adapted to fit new
phrases. Frere Jacques, once learned, is used many times, since, with
its repetitive phrasing, it allows the class to imitate what the radio
teacher sings without upsetting the natural arrangement of the song.
The musical theme of the series, Au Clair de la Lune. is learned not
for the French phrases but because children like to be able to sing
their radio program theme.
Don't expect too much...of yourself, of all the boys and girls, of the
seriesI The committee, however, feels confident you will be a little
surprised at the ease with which many of the young children learn French.
Although this series is designed for grade 2, we leave it to the dis¬
cretion of the teacher whether or not it may be used in other grades.
We have found that some first grades do very well, indeed.
Please feel free to write us your questions, criticism and comments.
VISITONS MIMI is just a first step toward familiarity with the French
language and better understanding of the French people.
